entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1: Final What's New & Product Assistance available
entry.content:
With immediate effect, the final What's New information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 is now available.

To access the final What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer. In addition, the final Product Assistance (aka Application Help) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 is available. Please use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Help Portal page to access it.

For you as a customer, we recommend to also use the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool. The Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.1 will be available in RASD within the next few days. A valid Customer S-user ID is required for login. We recommend to use RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you as a customer.

You can use the commenting feature for What’s New. With this feature, authors can evaluate your feedback and incorporate it into the documentation, if needed. We hope that by opening this channel of communication, we can learn how to further improve our What’s New content for you. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the Help Portal. The feature will only be available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.

entry.title: Re: Performance improvements in SAC Story Building
entry.content:
Hi,

Your observations on speed versus features in SAP SAC are very meaningful and practical. I appreciate the way you have tested and explained them clearly. Many community members, especially those working with large datasets, will find this very useful.

Just a small suggestion: this type of detailed content is better suited for the Blog section instead of Q&A. In Blogs, more members who search for such insights can find it easily, and it will also help you grow your community rank faster.

Thank you again for sharing your experience. Looking forward to more of your contributions.

entry.title: Effortless Integration: Archiving Service Cloud V2 Emails to OpenText
entry.content:
How It Works: A Seamless Process

This integration is triggered whenever a case is created or updated in SAP Service Cloud V2. The process is designed for a seamless, hands-off user experience:

  • A user triggers the process from a custom field within SAP Service Cloud V2
  • The iFlow retrieves the most recent email and any attachments associated with the specific service case.
  • The email body is converted into a universally readable PDF format to ensure compliance and audit readiness.
  • The system downloads all attachments linked to the email.
  • Finally, the formatted email and attachments are uploaded to OpenText and linked to the corresponding case for streamlined case management and compliance.
  • OpenText content management is embedded within SAP Service Cloud and users have access to OpenText’s embedded AI for analyzing documents stored within the workspace.

 

 

  • Key Features You'll Love

    • Dynamic Email Retrieval: The iFlow is configured to always fetch the most recent email, ensuring you have the latest information at your fingertips.
    • Universal Format: By converting the email body to a PDF, the solution guarantees that your records are stored in a universally readable and compliant format.
    • Comprehensive Attachment Handling: The process supports multiple attachments, archiving them alongside the email for a complete record.
    • Robust Error Handling: The system includes error-handling branches to automatically retry processes or log failures, ensuring reliability and data integrity.

      Technical Reliability

      This iFlow is deployed in SAP Cloud Integration and is triggered by an HTTP API call from SAP Service Cloud V2. It uses OAuth2-based authentication for secure communication with both SAP Service Cloud V2 and OpenText APIs. A custom Python API deployed on Cloud Foundry helps prepare the content for archiving.

entry.title: Workflows Migration.
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I'm looking for a guide, conversion objects matrix, or documentation on migrating workflows from an on-premise system to S/4 HANA. Keeping in mind that the target system only allows user access through SAP Fiori, I'm considering that.
That is, if a step in my workflow calls a transaction, what should I look for? A Fiori app if it's standard, or a Fiori development if it's a client transaction (z).
If a workflow step calls a classic SAP Fiori app, what should I do? Create a Fiori app?
How can i find this recomendations?

Thank you very much and best regards.
Dsanchez.

entry.title: Re: SAP learning journey for advanced variant configuration.
entry.content:
Hi @Losap1991 
Here are some suggestions:

  • Implementing Variant Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 25 Units 25 hrs Free Hands-on practice 
    In this Learning Journey consultants will learn how to implement Variant Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, Product Lifecycle Management.
  • Hands-on Practice for SAP S/4HANA Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC)
    This practice system is preconfigured with the data you need to carry out exercises from the course SAP S/4HANA Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC) or to experiment on your own with SAP S/4HANA 2022.

We also offer Live Ssession for this topic. Please find a list here.

Here are the links to the isnructor.led traing courses: 

  • S41800 SAP S/4HANA Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC)
    This is a delta course. It contains the deltas related to variant configuration from SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA on the corresponding release. 
  • S4RD2 SAP S/4HANA Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC)
    This is a delta course. It contains the deltas related to variant configuration from SAP ERP to SAP S/4HANA on the corresponding release. The main focus is on Advanced Variant Configuration (AVC).

We do not provide a certification for this topic.

Kind reards
Margit

entry.title: Recruiting - limitation on sorting functionality up to 150 candidates only - is it gonna be enlarged
entry.content:
Currently we encounter the limitation on sorting functionality in new Candidate Workbench where we can not sort all the New Applications Skills Compatibility score from top to bottom if there is more than 150 applicants. In our Indian entities though this is exactly the business case ..... hundreds of applicants for one position and not easy way how to sort the CVs quickly by any criteria to make the recruiter life easier.  We were hoping that by enabling skills we will have the advantage of sorting by Skill Compatibility and prioritize the applications with higher score.

Is it planned to enlarge the scope for sorting , or give the user chance to display the amount of rows to match the limitations ?

Nowadays when applications overreached the 150 then there is just a popp up error that sorting function is not available for use , but user has no chance to divide the list of applicants to separate pages of 150 or less.

entry.title: IBS/CBS - Tax Reform - Collection & disbursement
entry.content:
Taxation Processes:

The new taxes will replace some existing taxes over time. Taxes like IR (Income Tax), INSS (Social Security Contribution), and CSLL (Social Contribution on Net Profit) will remain unchanged.

IBS (Tax on Goods and Services):

  • Will cover the ISS for the Insurance industry, which is currently based on service type.
  • Calculated considering:
    • IBS for Jurisdiction
    • IBS for State
  • IBS Jurisdiction can follow the same procedure as ISS based on Jurisdiction code on BP side.
  • IBS State may require using the BP address to identify the state.
  • The proposal is to have a unique tax rate, but flexibility to have different taxes for different states and jurisdictions should be considered during customization.

CBS (Contribution on Goods and Services):

  • Will cover the PIS/COFINS taxation.
  • The customization for this new Federal tax could follow the same IBS proposal.
  • Tax reduction can be expected in some cases.

Attention Points and Definitions:

  • The new taxes should be withheld and not mixed with the old ones.
  • No dependency should be created between new and old taxes, including tax base, tax reduction, etc.

IBS State and Jurisdiction Details:

  • For IBS Jurisdiction, the same method can be used in customizing by creating a Tax supplement and relating it to a GL account.
  • This tax is triggered at the time of payment.
  • The same customization method can be used to choose the Portion Subject of Tax and the Tax percentage.
  • No threshold limit has been defined for this tax.
  • Calculation is only possible if the currency is BRL.
  • The taxation will have a fixed tax rate per jurisdiction and state, but different tax rates and portion reductions may exist in the same jurisdiction or state, potentially differentiated by service type.
  • For customizing IBS state and jurisdiction, the same procedure used in ISS can be used to choose the jurisdiction and state.
  • Different fields are needed to configure the tax rate, which will be collected based on the service local executed.
  • These new taxes have no dependencies on each other, so there is no need to set Tax Sequence.
  • A TAX FM could be interesting to maintain for the flexibility point of view, in case the external system already calculates these taxes and needs to feed our system with this information.

CBS Federal Tax Details:

  • CBS is a Federal tax, and the same procedure as adopted for Tax Code and Tax Supplement can be followed.
  • This taxation will replace PIS/COFINS, so the same approach can be used or another that is more convenient.
  • Flexibility could be interesting to keep, as well as Portion reduction, differentiate by type of segment (currently per service type).
  • Some rules based on this tax may change in the future.

Practical Implications for Now (2025)

  • No CBS or IBS collection yet; both are scheduled to begin in 2026.

  • Systems should be configured to support 0.9% CBS and 0.1% IBS for the transition, while remaining adaptable for rate increases.

  • Legacy taxes (PIS, COFINS, ICMS, ISS) still apply until they're phased out progressively.

The solution will be released in FSCD until the end of September 2025.

entry.title: Using Technical User in SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs (Client Credentials)
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere exposes business-ready data through a set of Consumption APIs that make it easy for BI tools and applications to query governed data without copying it. The Consumption APIs endpoints generated from Analytical Datasets and Analytic Models offer a metadata-rich, RESTful interface that applications can call for filtered, paged results, which have been available since early 2021. 

To allow all this richness of data and the benefits of federation capabilities, the SAP Dataspshere Consumption APIs always relied on business users for authentication and authorizations, which is based OAuth 2.0 with Authorization Code grant type. Such scenario ensured the same behaviour the user sees in the SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics applications would be the one be the same when integrating via APIs, including Data Access Controls and Model Privileges.

However such authorization method is not the most adequate to be used when integration in backend application, in a service-to-service manner. As in most cases the backend application does not have an current user session or ability to access a browser context as required by Authorization Code grant type 3-lagged approach.

With that we heard our users requests and pleased to release the "Technical User" support for the SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs which is based on OAuth 2.0 with Client Credentials grant type (2-legged). This allows the access token generation to happen without any manual user interaction.

This blog post cover details on how to create the "Technical User" OAuth Client in SAP Datasphere, how to setup the client credentiral authorization in Postman and the support for it on Power BI Custom Connector.

Technical User OAuth Client

The Technical User OAuth client work just like the other OAuth clients existing in SAP Datasphere. To define the authorizations for the technical user at least one scoped role needs to be assigned to it, this will determine which spaces the technical user will have access and the privileges it will have in them.  Also, to identify the requests made and to apply data access restrictions a "Username" must be provided, this technical user name needs to be unique across the entire SAP Datasphere tenant.

For creating a Technical User OAuth client, go to System > Administration > App Integration and provide the following information

  • Purpose: Technical User
  • User ID:  <unique username>
  • Roles: <Select at least one scoped role>

After creating it generates a "Client ID" and a "Client Secret", just like the other OAuth client types.

 

Integrating with Consumption APIs in Postman

Integrating with SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs using a Technical User OAuth client is straightforward because it uses the Client Credentials grant type. Using the client_id and client_secret created in the previous section, along with the SAP Datasphere token URL available on the App Integration page, you can use any HTTP client (e.g., Postman) to generate an access token and call the Consumption APIs.

Access Token Generation

Postman Automated OAuth Setup

Postman’s automated authorization handles all the necessary OAuth 2.0 calls to retrieve and apply the token. To set this up, create a new request and open the Authorization tab. For Type, select OAuth 2.0 and fill in the following information:

  • Header Prefix: Bearer
  • Grant type: Client Credentials
  • Access Token URL: <SAP Datasphere Token URL available the App Integration page>
  • Client ID: <client_id - created on previous step>
  • Client Secret: <client_secret - created on previous step>

After you complete the fields, click Get New Access Token. Postman will generate an access token for SAP Datasphere.

Postman Manual OAuth Setup

Postman’s approach in the previous section automates the OAuth protocol, which is helpful for testing and speeding up debugging, but less practical for real integrations. This section explains how to craft the OAuth token request required by the Client Credentials flow for use with a SAP Datasphere Technical User.

Create a request in Postman and configure:

  • Method: POST
  • Request URL: <token_url> (the SAP Datasphere token URL available on the App Integration page)

Headers:

  • Authorization: Basic <base64 encoded client_id:client_secret>
  • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

Body (x-www-form-urlencoded):

  • grant_type: client_credentials

Send the request to retrieve the access token, which you will use later.

 

Changes on SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs

The SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs let you retrieve data via OData version 4. Starting with release 2025.19, the standard API path has been updated to align with proper service naming following the 2023 transition from SAP Data Warehouse Cloud to SAP Datasphere and its continued role within the SAP Business Data Cloud strategy.

  • New path: /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/*

The catalog service for consumption artifacts, which lists and queries all accessible spaces and entities, has moved to /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/catalog/* to better reflect its purpose. All other semantics for accessing spaces and assets remain unchanged.

The relational and analytical consumption endpoints retain exactly the same behavior, with only the path prefix changed, for example:

  • /api/v1/datasphere/consumption/(relational | analytical)/*

The previous path, /api/v1/dwc/(catalog|consumption), is deprecated. It will continue to be supported for 18 months, until March 2027.

Consuming with Technical User

You can use the Technical User with both the old and new API paths. Once you switch to Technical User authorization, it is recommended to move to the new standard endpoints.

When you make requests to the Consumption APIs with Technical User authorization, the privileges and space memberships applied to the request are determined by the scoped roles assigned to the OAuth client used to generate the access token.

For example, consider spaces A, B, and C. If the OAuth client has roles that grant consumption permissions for spaces A and C, then:

  • In catalog queries, only assets from spaces A and C are returned.
  • For data consumption, only models belonging to or shared with spaces A and C are accessible.

An example request is shown in the image below, which requests data from a view in relational format, use the generated access token from previous step as Bearer Authorization.

Important notice: Consuming data from assets protected by Data Access Controls is not supported at this time. The API will return an empty result.

 

Integration with Power BI via Custom Connector

Back in 2022, olaf_fischer and I worked on easing the integration between Power BI and the SAP Datasphere Consumption APIs by releasing an open source sample Power BI Custom Connector that supports SSO, making it easy to authenticate and consume the OData APIs in Power BI.

Although the custom connector has its limitations and active development has ceased, the introduction of a new authorization type is a significant improvement. Since the connector is used by many, it deserved an update to align with the latest features. I am happy to share that version 1.90 of the open source custom connector now supports authorization via OAuth 2.0 with client credentials.

More details on the custom connector can be found at original blog post or on the GitHub Repository

How to Use It in Power BI

  1. In the connector sign-in dialog, choose Authentication Method → “OAuth Client Credentials.”
  2. Enter the Client ID and Client Secret generated when you registered the app.
  3. Leave the existing Access Token URL in the system settings (connections.json file); no additional user details are required.

Backward-Compatibility Notes

  • Existing connections that use the Authorization Code flow continue to work unchanged.
  • You can reuse the same system configuration (Access Token URL) if you switch to the new Client Credentials flow later.
 

Summary

SAP Datasphere now supports Technical User access to the Consumption APIs with OAuth 2.0 client credentials, enabling service-to-service integrations without user interaction and thereby easing integration across multiple services and enabling many new use cases.

I’d be happy to hear your thoughts and comments on this topic. Let me know in the comments

entry.title: Re: Excited to Join the SAP Community

entry.title: How to set up Withholding Tax in Treasury Using Extended Withholding Tax
entry.content:
This blog describes setup of the withholding tax using integration from SAP Treasury and Risk Management (treasury) to the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting. Besides the calculation and accounting this integration also ensures that corresponding withholding tax information is added to the resulting accounting documents. Such documents are included in standard legal reports in a given country. There are also other possibilities to calculate and account withholding taxes, e.g. using derived flows, however the resulting documents usually lack all the necessary withholding tax information.

Pre-delivered configuration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud enables posting to supplier. However, this example scenario covers withholding tax on incoming interests in money market instruments posted to customer to describe all configuration steps. 

We focus on the configuration and master data related to withholding tax, we expect that you have already completed general setup for treasury and for the extended withholding tax in Financial Accounting.

 

1          Customizing Prerequisites

The withholding tax code and tax type are defined in Financial Accounting.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Payment Time, the system generates the withholding tax only at the time of payment in the transaction F110 (Automatic Payment). In this case, treasury generates only an empty flow and a corresponding item for table WITH_ITEM with withholding tax base amount.

If the withholding tax code is defined as Invoice Time, the system generates the withholding tax line item in the accounting document of the interest. Treasury then generates a flow with withholding tax amount.

 

2          Customizing in Treasury

2.1       Define Update Type for Withholding Tax

In our example we use update type TAXWH01.

2.2       Define Account Determination for Interest

The extended withholding tax requires posting to supplier/customer, therefore it is necessary to set up account determination for interest in treasury accordingly.

2.2.1     Posting Specification

It contains document type for posting on customer and GL account. The posting key for debit entry is for customer, and the account symbol has posting category for subledger posting in payment currency.

2.2.2     Assign Update Type to Posting Specification

It is important to mark the indication Payment Transaction in the assignment of the update type to posting specification.

2.3       Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax

In this activity we assign the withholding tax update type to the interest update type.

Note. Only maintain key fields that are relevant for the actual interest flow. If you maintain securities account for interest from money market instrument, the configuration won’t be selected in the processing, because money market instrument doesn’t carry securities account.

If you have a scenario with interest for securities do not maintain transaction type, because interests in securities account management (transaction TPM40) don’t carry transaction type.

The assignment also contains the withholding tax type and withholding tax code.

 

3          Business Partner Master Data

The withholding tax data are maintained in the corresponding tab Customer: Withholding Tax        

Note that the withholding tax and withholding tax code must be same as in the activity Specify Flow Attributes for Extended Withholding Tax. Also, the indicator withholding tax agent must be set.

 

4         Processing of the financial transaction

4.1       Create Financial Transaction

Enter the money market transaction as usual. On payment details page, it is crucial that the interest is posted to customer and without payment request:

 

The generated planned withholding tax isn’t visible directly under the Cash Flow tab. You can check it in the transaction TPM13 Treasury Position Flows – Classic

Note that this is only planned withholding tax. In some cases, the withholding tax can depend on some limits related to the business partner, and so the resulting withholding tax at the time of posting can differ. The cash flow in TPM13 serves as a good indication whether everything is set up correctly and the withholding tax is generated.

4.2       Post financial transaction

The withholding tax is posted together with the interest in the transaction TBB1 (Fix, Pay, and Post Flows). There is a limitation in posting log, which puts withholding tax in two-line items, whereas resulting accounting document has only one line item for withholding tax.

For more information about the basic settings for withholding tax, see Withholding Tax in Treasury.

We have association between Departments (Parent and Child). Each department has fields called Parent Department (data type: Department) and Head of Department (data type: User).


The Head of Department must have the capability to access the Department for which he/she serves as Head, as well as the ability to drill down to the lowest level of the department.

Please suggest on how it can be achieved via RBP.

Best Regards

entry.title: Re: How to create ODATA v4 POST API where it will take in...
entry.content:
Hi,
For an SAP RAP service you need to use a table to project your CDS entities into (those will be your input and output data), if you don't want to, and if you are in a on-premise or Private Cloud S/4HANA System, you can use the SAP Gateway Builder (SEGW) to create entity types/sets directly and use function import for your need create the service function.
You can check an example here for Function import implementation https://signatov.com/using-function-import-in-an-odata-service/

entry.title: Re: You cannot make an assignment to make-to-order stock...

On My case I have activate valuated stock in WBS. Since got the issue. Later changed the WBS to no valuated and planned order got converted and wbs has been picked as settlement rule for process order.
Set the OKO7 as below

Set the no valuated CJ20N

Auto picking of Settlement rule in process order while converting the planned order. MD04

Business was using the WBS settlement for service materials (service process orders).

entry.title: Get started with SAP Databricks: Introduction
entry.content:
**Updated September 2025**

Welcome to our blog series focused on SAP Databricks.  

This guide provides a comprehensive, step-by-step approach to help you get started on SAP Databricks.

This series has 6 parts as follows: 

  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Introduction (this post)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Set up your SAP Databricks account (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Identity management and permissions (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Networking and security (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Connect to external data sources (coming soon)
  • Get started with SAP Databricks: Monitor costs in SAP Databricks (coming soon)

What's Databricks? Databricks was founded in 2013 and is a Data Intelligence Platform with an open lakehouse architecture. Its goal is to simplify and democratize data and AI, helping technical teams solve the world’s toughest problems. 

What's SAP Databricks? Partnership between SAP and Databricks announced on February 2025  to natively bring Databricks capabilities to SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), such as zero-copy delta sharing, advanced AI and machine learning (ML). 

How is SAP Databricks measured? In SAP BDC, the metric is Capacity Units (CU) that considers storage, serverless SQL compute, object store storage and requests, etc. You can estimate how much CU you need here. For SAP Databricks, the billing is based on actual consumption rather than what is defined in the quota assignment; it means that, if you need, you can exceed the number of CU assigned during the provisioning. If you want to change the quota assignment in SAP BDC, you can follow this guidance. 

How can I purchase SAP Databricks? Currently, the commercial model available is through subscription - it means you need to sign a contract with SAP to buy SAP BDC with the appropriate amount of CU to provision SAP Databricks. 

Image 1: SAP Databricks Home Screen

Sources:

entry.title: Backup & Restore Approach for SAP HANA Systems with Encryption Enabled
entry.content:
Hello Guys,

This blog is related to backup restore approach of sap hana system when encryption is enabled.

So, the first question is: What is encryption in backup and restore?
Backup encryption protects the contents of data backups, log backups, and delta/differential backups using the AES-256 encryption algorithm. The encryption is performed using Backup Encryption Root Keys (BEKs), which are 256 bits in length.

If ENCRYPTION is enabled for backups, restoring or refresh of that backup is slightly different from the normal process.

First, we need to verify if backup ENCRYPTION is enabled using the following command:

SELECT * FROM M_ENCRYPTION_OVERVIEW;

If encryption is enabled for backup, we cannot directly restore the encrypted backup. We will need the SSFS root key used to encrypt the backup.

Process to Check the Encryption Keys Used for Backup & Log Encryption

How can I find out if the instance SSFS contains the root keys used to encrypt backups

/usr/sap/H46/HDB00/exe/hdbnsutil -printHashedRootKeys --dbid=<dbid> --verbose

In the above screenshot keys are mentioned by which backup, logs are encrypted, this is just for our reference.

Here in the above screenshot dbid is there, we can find dbid by executing below command from SYSTEMDB.

SELECT DATABASE_NAME, CASE WHEN (DBID = '' AND DATABASE_NAME = 'SYSTEMDB') THEN 1 WHEN (DBID = '' AND DATABASE_NAME <> 'SYSTEMDB') THEN 3 ELSE TO_INT(DBID) END DATABASE_ID FROM (SELECT DISTINCT DATABASE_NAME, SUBSTR_AFTER (SUBPATH,'.') AS DBID FROM SYS_DATABASES.M_VOLUMES);

Just for the knowledge purpose where is instance SSFS located on to the hana server.

The default path to the key file (SSFS_<SID>.DAT)  of the instance SSFS is

$DIR_GLOBAL/hdb/security/ssfs.

Note : Never manually change any of the files related to the instance SSFS. For all administrative tasks related to instance SSFS, use the SAP HANA tool hdbnsutil.

/usr/sap/SID/HDB<instance number>/exe/hdbnsutil.

If you already have root key backup and key passphrase by which backup encrypted then its easy for you to restore, otherwise you have to follow below steps .

Backup Root keys 

-----------------------------

Below are the steps for exporting the root keys from the instance SSFS:

  1. The encryption root key backup is secured using a passphrase, which must be set before creating the SSFS key backup (export).

  2. To set the passphrase, the system privilege ENCRYPTION ROOT KEY ADMIN is required.

  3. Use the following SQL statement to set the encryption root key backup passphrase:

  4. ALTER SYSTEM SET ENCRYPTION ROOT KEYS BACKUP PASSWORD "<passphrase>";

As per the above image root key password has been changed for both systemDB & tenantDB.

Once the passphrase is set, you can export the encryption root key from the source system.

To backup the encryption root keys, use export root key functionality.
/usr/sap/H46/HDB00/exe/hdbnsutil -backupRootKeys <filename>.rkb --dbid=<dbid> --type='ALL'

Importing Source system Root Keys into Target System.

you need to import the source system’s backup root keys into the target system. However, before importing the source root key, ensure that you take a backup of the target system’s encryption keys.

First transfer & validate the password for the source system root key backup file ( *.rkb) in target system before import.
/usr/sap/H46/HDB00/exe/hdbnsutil -validateRootKeysBackup <filename>.rkb.

To import the source system root key file into target, make sure target database must be offline, otherwise you will get below error message

Import the backup encryption root keys by using following command.

./hdbnsutil -recoverRootKeys <filename>.rkb --dbid=<dbid> --type=<type>

now validate backup root key for both system before starting actual restore of database.

dbid 4 backup key and dbid 3 backup key both are same now.

Now we are ready to proceed with the restore using the normal process, as the source root keys have been successfully imported into the target system.

I performed this on my trial system. Before carrying out any activities related to encryption root keys in your environment, it is strongly recommended to review 2444090 - FAQ: SAP HANA Backup Encryption - SAP for Me

Thank you for reading! Feel free to drop comments or questions — I’d be happy to help.

entry.title: Transportation Cockpit Button and corresponding action
entry.content:
Dear experts,

i am new to SAP TM developing and have a question regarding how to implement a custom button.

My Task is to implement a custom button in transportation Cockpit at freight unit level and execute an action.

what i did until now:

- i created an enhancement for Business object  /SCMTMS/TOR and generated constant interface

- i created a button in customizing and activated it in floorplan Manager

- i created an action under the root node in the BO enhancement.

- the execute method of the action is implemented.

the button is displayed in the freight unit section at the button bar, so far so good.

but when i click the button the action is not triggered and i don´t understand why.

Can you please give me a hint where to set a breakpoint so i can see why my action is not triggered ?

Thanks in advance.

if more information is needed i will of course provide them.

thanks again.

René

entry.title: Re: How to Deploy/Publish RAP & Annotation based UI List...
entry.content:
Hello @G_Sachin 

For S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, custom UI5 apps are delivered alongside on SAP BTP and integrated as remote apps. Only SAPUI5 Adaptation Projects app variants are deployed to the ABAP repository. If a deployment returns a 403 error, it might be because the custom app target is not supported, use BTP deploy and Launchpad integration instead or the developer setup or authorisation for the adaptation project is incomplete. Check that SAP_BR_DEVELOPER and the correct BAS destination are set, then transport via Export Software Collection.

Here are some helpful SAP S4HANA Public Cloud help links for your reference

Extensibility: Key User and Side-by-Side

  • Extensibility Options in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • SAP Extensibility Explorer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud (for interactive options)

UI Adaptation and App Variants
Adapt UI and Create App Variants

  • Adapting SAP Fiori UIs at Runtime - Key User Adaptation
  • SAP Help-Adapting the UI
  • Work with SAPUI5 Adaptation Projects to generate and make simple changes to an application variant of an SAP Fiori application in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1 of 3)
  • SAP Help Saving App Variants

Deployment of UI Adaptation Projects
Deploy UI Adaptation Projects in BAS

  • Deploy or Update the Adaptation Project to the ABAP Repository-SAP Help

Transport via Export Software Collection
Export Software Collection

  • 3126032 - Export/import Software Collections in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Frequently Asked Questions

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How can I set an anchor at a Work Zone page
entry.content:
Normally in html you'd add an anchor to your target page eg.

<h2><a id="test_anchor"></a>Section 3</h2>

Then add to your outbound link the id of the anchor eg. 

<a href="example-page.html#test_anchor">Link to anchor in target page</a>.

Work Zone appears to strip out anything appended to the URL before rendering the target page so it doesn't appear possible to link to the anchor from an external page. 

Interestingly you can get an anchor link to work for an anchor in the SAME page as the link. BUT you can't use the ID attribute as per the html spec. The anchor has to look like this:

<h2><a name="test_anchor"></a>Section 3</h2>
Note NAME attribute, not ID.

When you do this (you'll have to add the name attribute in the view source function of a text widget) you'll see the anchor appear like this in the edit UI:

Note the little bookmark icon. 

The link to the anchor must be in the same page and must look like this:

<a href="#test_anchor">Link to anchor</a>

So in summary, another poor implementation from Work Zone, denying us the tools we need to do a decent job with our content.

entry.title: New Intelligent Search Available in Beta Phase
entry.content:
If you take a close look at the search field available throughout SAP Community, you’ll notice a new option in the pulldown: Beta Search. This search introduces several new filtering options, including the ability to filter by SAP Managed Tag and by question status such as unanswered questions (one of the most requested features from members!). 

Powered by Coveo, this new federated search pulls from multiple repositories, not just SAP Community. In fact, this new search will also be available on other SAP sites – including SAP.com, SAP Store, and SAP Support Portal – with a consistent UI and design, creating a better user experience as visitors navigate across SAP’s various online destinations. 

You can narrow your search down to specific sites from the top tabs – selecting Products, Community, or Support – but if you want hits from various platforms, you can refine via the All Results tab. From there, you can click several options under the Document Type dropdown. For example, in addition to the standard options that you would expect for SAP Community (such as Question, Discussion, and Blog Post), you can choose Learning Journey, SAP Knowledge Base Article, and News and Press. 

That’s a small sample of what’s available. Looking for training content from SAP Developer Center? Click the Tutorial box. Need material from SAP Help Portal? Select Product Documentation. There’s even a Video option if you’re looking for media from SAP channels on YouTube.  

Additional options will allow you to find products directly on the SAP Store site. Depending on the search topic, you may even get an AI-generated answer – although the beta results will require additional learning and refinement.  

While the results above may not be completely accurate, all of this search will get smarter over time – thanks to you. Coveo relies on a machine-learning model that reacts to user behavior, so your activity will play an important role in improving search outcomes. 

And speaking of outcomes – as an SAP Community member, you’re likely interested in what the search outcomes mean for users trying to find information on our site. We encourage you to test the beta search and see for yourself. You’ll notice some options remain the same, compared to the platform’s current search – such as filtering by date – whereas options for searching for users and authors are gone - but will come back with later phases of the search project.

You’ll also find a few new dropdowns, including menus for filtering SAP Community results by specific products and SAP Managed Tags. You can select multiple options from recommendations or search available products and tags to fine-tune results. 

Perhaps most importantly, you’ll be able to filter questions by status (answered, solved, and open), meeting one of the biggest demands from members looking to find (or provide) solutions to problems. 

During the beta phase, you’ll still be able to use the normal SAP Community site search. Results for the beta search will only pull public content – meaning you won’t be able to use it to find information from any private groups (if you belong to any).  

We expect the beta phase to run through the rest of 2025 – possibly into the middle of 2026. We’ll provide updates about future phases in What’s New as they become available. 

Try the new beta search for yourself, compare it to the current search, and leave your questions and observations in the comments below or give feedback via our community inbox sapcommunity@sap.com. We look forward to your feedback!

entry.title: SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception - SAP Connect 2025
entry.content:
Dear Valued Customers, 
 
We are pleased to make you aware about a special opportunity at SAP Connect (Las Vegas, October 6-8, 2025) for SAP MaxAttention customers:

SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception

During SAP Connect, we offer an exclusive SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception, taking place October 7 to provide you the chance to connect with peers, exchange ideas, and build meaningful relationships in a relaxed setting. 

This dinner will bring together selected SAP MaxAttention customers and SAP executives in an inspiring atmosphere – designed to foster focused conversations on strategic IT priorities and valuable peer exchange. It’s a great option to share experiences and strengthen trusted relationships outside the formal environment. 

In case you are interested in joining the SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception at the SAP Connect in Las Vegas please reach to maxattention@sap.com.

What is SAP Connect?

SAP Connect is a premier event where individuals can explore innovative SAP solutions. Through thought‑leading keynotes, expert‑led sessions, and real‑world demonstrations, you gain direct access to SAP’s latest solutions tailored to your line of business, inspiring stories that bring real-world results to life, and engage in a high-value dialogue with SAP leadership, partners, and peers. If you're interested in learning more about SAP Connect or plan to attend, please click here.

In case of any questions don’t hesitate to reach out.

We look forward to seeing you there and engaging with you.

Best regards,

Your SAP MaxAttention Team

entry.title: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I’m currently working on a costing scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I would like your insights.

My situation is as follows:

  • I want to produce a Finished Good (FG) along with a Co-Product.

  • I have already generated the BOM of the FG, which contains the cost of each component.

  • I created the Work Center, assigned each Activity Type (Setup, Machine Time, Personnel Time), and determined the price of each activity type.

  • When I create the Cost Estimate of the product, I can see the direct material costs (from BOM) and the direct production costs (from activity types).

👉 However, what I cannot see are the overhead costs (such as administration, sales, and other indirect costs).

My question to the community is:

  • How can I generate those overhead costs in the cost estimate within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Which configuration steps do I need to follow?

  • Which applications (Fiori apps) are used to set this up and run the process?

Any guidance, best practices, or resources would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Simplifying PM Task List Migration: Iterative Loading of Operations and Suboperations
entry.content:
Why an Iterative Approach?

  • The operation numbers are system-generated or derived during the first load.
  • Suboperations must reference the parent operation Node.
  • This dependency makes it practical to load operations first, capture the operation Node, and then load suboperations.

Step 1: Creation of Custom object

Create a custom Migration object by enhancing the existing standard cockpit object by adding 3 fields at the S_OPERATIONS Structure:

  1. ZZPLNKN-Node
  2. ZZUVORN- Suboperation Number
  3. ZZSUMNR- Suboperation Node

After adding above fields in Source structure complete the filed mapping to the target and complete the customization.

 

 

Note: we need to replicate the field PLNKN for the S_MPACK structure as well, if you are using Maintenance strategy:

Step 2: Load Operations (Iteration 1)

  1. Prepare your input file with the following details:
    • Task List Group (PLNNR), Group Counter (PLNAL), Activity number (VORNR), node (ZZPLNKN)

Note: during first iteration load the records with operation numbers only to be loaded in technical terms load the task list that has blank or zero in SUMNR filed from source

 

  1. Use the custom cockpit object created to   load the operations.
  2. Capture the generated Node number (ZZPLNKN) from the output of the FM.
    • These numbers will serve as reference keys for loading suboperations in the next iteration.

Step 2: Load Suboperations (Iteration 2)

  1. Prepare a second input file including:

Note: during Second iteration load the records with Sub-operation numbers only to be loaded in technical terms load the task list that has value in SUMNR filed from source

    • Task List Group (PLNNR), Group Counter (PLNAL), node (ZZPLNKN)
    •  Activity number (VORNR) – Update this filed with parent VORNR value
    • Suboperation Number (UVORN)- Should be updated in sequence
    • Suboperation Node (ZZSUMNR)- this filed is to be updated with the newly generated NODE(PLNKN) from the system.

 

  1. Use the custom cockpit object created to again load the sub-operations.
  2. Validate in SAP:
    • Suboperations should appear nested under the correct parent operations in the General Task List. Shown below

 

Key Considerations

  • Ensure the task list header is already created before starting.
  • Maintain sequence numbers correctly for operations and suboperations.
  • Validate both iterations in a test system before executing in QA or Production.
  • Log all generated operation numbers for audit and troubleshooting.

Benefits of This Approach

  • Handles dependency between operations and suboperations cleanly
  • Reduces risk of errors during cutover
  • Can be repeated for dry runs and mock loads before final cutover
  • Compatible with SAP Migration Cockpit (via staging tables) and custom load programs

Conclusion

By adopting a two-step iterative approach with Existing Migration cockpit object, you can ensure accurate loading of both operations and suboperations for General Maintenance Task Lists. This method has proven effective in avoiding errors due to missing operation references and makes the data migration smoother.

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an in...
entry.content:
Hello,

maybe you are looking for method worksheet->convert_to_table ?

Try to check demo program 51 (ZDEMO_EXCEL51) where this method is showcased.
Preview:

CREATE OBJECT lo_reader TYPE zcl_excel_reader_2007.
lo_excel = lo_reader->load( lv_excel_xstring ).
lo_worksheet = lo_excel->get_worksheet_by_index( 1 ).
lo_worksheet->convert_to_table(
  IMPORTING
    et_data = lt_test               "a) If you know the structure
    er_data = DATA(lref_dyn_table)  "b) Dynamic option
).

If you want it to be dynamic, you can use exporting parameter ER_DATA, where you will find generated table (type ref to data).

entry.title: Re: SAP Utilities Core: Your onboarding journey and whom you are going to meet along the way and whe
entry.content:
Hello

writing under my Demando-ID I would like to ask an important question:

entry.title: Re: Can we create an intercompany stock transfer order fo...
entry.content:
Hello @Bernard_Sohier 

For S/4HANA Public Cloud, intercompany STOs (5DV/5HP) only support unrestricted stock; direct transfer of project stock with a WBS is not possible. The workaround is to receive in unrestricted stock and then repost it into project stock or handle it via intercompany project billing.
Intercompany Stock Transfer – Scope Item 5DV

Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer-SAP Help

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content: Hello Anandhusap. The screen capture you are showing is of Employee Sub-Group Groupings, which is not the same as Employee Groups. If you do a Payroll Simulation for one employee with the Display Log box checked, and drill down into the Log to PCR ZPN7, you should be able to see the Function that call ZPN7 (along with its parameters) and contents of the Input Table at that point in Payroll Calculation,. In that Input Table, some WTs will have ESG * while some others will have ESG 1 to 9. Please show us the Function call for ZPN7 and the Input line for WT 2071.

entry.title: Upskilling with SAP: Alex's Journey into the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
Re: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content: Make sure you are calling the correct token service URL for your BTP subaccount/tenant. SAP has known 401s when the token’s subdomain/tenant doesn’t match the CPI tenant. If the token is issued for a different subdomain the CPI will reject it.

entry.title: Setup Time in Production orders not considered correctly
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

the system is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508.

As you will see on the attached screenshot: 10 min of setup time are leading to 11:26 min difference between Earliest Execution time and Earliest Processing time, which in my understanding should be exactly the setup time. And this is the same not just for one Work center. 

The same behavior is observed with the Processing time - when the orders are scheduled more time is calculated than expected based on the data and the formulas in the WC.

Please advice what am I doing wrong, or where I should take a look to have logical explanation of this behavior.

Thank you in advance,

Peter Kozlev

entry.title: ‌🇸🇬‌ SAP Singapore Localization Forum 2025
entry.content:
Join us on November 6th for the 2025 Localization event. This year, we will share the show case of SAP Business AI, provide essential updates on recent legal changes impacting Singapore and offer a comprehensive overview of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solutions applicable to Singapore. Participants will gain valuable insights into SAP localization solutions designed to accelerate global digital business transformation.

REGISTER HERE 

Date
November 6th, 2025 | 9:30 a.m. – 4:00 p.m. Singapore time

Venue
SAP Asia Office, Mapletree Business City (Level 3, Room 309)
                       30 Pasir Panjang road 117440 Map.

Note:

  •       The event has maximum of 120 seats. Attendance will be confirmed closer to the event date.
  •       The event will feature two parallel tracks in the afternoon i.e. SAP HCM and SAP DRC-ERP.
  •       For the afternoon session, one of the tracks will has maximum of 40 seats at Level 5, Room 515-C2, where the other track will remain at Level 3, Room 309.
  •       Human Capital Management track in the afternoon will have both onsite and online, please select your preferred attendance mode when registering. Online participants will receive a webinar link before the event.
  •       SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track in the afternoon will only have onsite, the recording will be shared in SAP Workspace: Singapore SAP Document and Reporting Compliance after the event.

Agenda
Morning Session

9:30 - Registration & Light Breakfast
10:00 - Welcome & Globalization Service Strategy
10:30 - SAP Business AI Showcase
11:30 - Lunch break 1 hour

Afternoon Session – SAP HCM Track

12:30 - Overview of HCM statutory update
13:00 - Part 1- IRAS Reporting and Key Changes for YA2026
14:00 - Part 2- CPF Reporting and Legal Changes in 2025
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Part 3- Introducing MOM OED Reporting
15:15 - Q&A Session
15:50 - Wrap up and End

Afternoon Session – SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track

12:30 - Step-by-Step guide for GST online submission & Cash Flow statement and Demo of Smart form handling with AI
13:30 - The Latest updates of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for InvoiceNow (Peppol)
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Recap of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for GST InvoiceNow
15:45 - Wrap up and End

Additional information, including the speaker list, are available here.

entry.title: Delta Sync Issue in SSAM 2505 with Basic Authentication
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are setting up a new development application using SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2505 with Basic Authentication. During testing, we noticed that delta sync is not working consistently.

Some mobile users are receiving the latest backend changes through delta sync, while others are not. This is causing data mismatches across devices.

Has anyone faced similar issues with delta sync when using Basic Authentication? Any suggestions or insights would be helpful.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Migration Issues SAPBO 4.2 to 4.3: PMW error and Missing Relationships with CMC Promotion Management
entry.content:
We currently have an SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.2 SP5 platform deployed on Linux, and we have installed a new SAP BO 4.3 SP3 platform on a separate Linux server.

To perform the migration, we attempted to use the Promotion Management Wizard (PMW). After entering the credentials, the wizard gets stuck at the "Logging in" stage and does not proceed further. We have verified network connectivity between both servers and confirmed that it is working correctly.

As an alternative, we used the Promotion Management tool available in the Central Management Console (CMC). Through direct import (without generating an intermediate LCMBIAR file), we were able to bring over some objects. However, we noticed that certain relationships were not preserved in the target system. For example, users lost their permissions on universes after the import.

We are using the Administrator in both environments.

Content scope: 

  • number of reports: around 300
  • universes: 15
  • users: 50

Questions:

  1. Why the PMW is not progressing beyond the login stage despite correct credentials and connectivity.
  2. What is the recommended and most reliable method to perform a complete migration of all content (including users, universes, reports, folders, and security relationships) from SAP BO 4.2 to SAP BO 4.3.

Best regards

entry.title: Purchase requisition is not automatically generated when creating the process order
entry.content:
Hello,

Usually when i create a process order, a purchase requisition is automatically created for the material with the item category N : Non stocked (Service item).

But now, when i create a process order, SAP skip the screen of PR creation and generate this error in the LOG : 

As if the system is trying to create the PR but it do not find a value for the requisitioner field and cancel the creation.

But normally, the system used to display the ME51N screen for me when i am creating the process order. And i insert manually the requisitioner in the PR.

Thank you for your help,

Best Regards;

Name  I set YY1_00800238_CRT_19.
Theres is nothing in applications log

I event debugged the class method CL_SWF_RUN_WIM_DIALOG=>CREATE_VIA_WFM and observerd that entry was not getting saved in table SWW_WIREGISTER. But not able to identify why.

No emails are being sent for PO recipient. Although workitem is available in the user inbox.

I have followed the above blog exactly.
